p: Chikungunya virus (CHIKV), a mosquito-borne alphavirus of the Togaviridae family, has caused over 70 epidemics between 1952 and 2018. It was first identified in 1952 in present day Tanzania (East Africa), and was isolated from infected patientsâ€™ sera, and from Aedes and Culex spp. mosquitoes in 1953 [ 1]. In the late 1950s, CHIKV was described in Uganda, the sub-Saharan region, and in Central and Southern Africa [ 2]. Based on the phylogenetic analysis of the CHIKV sequences from these early African outbreaks, they were grouped under the East-, Central-, and South-African lineage (ECSA) [ 3].
